Posts.Content: I agree with your comments I try to be strong and friends say it's amazing how positive  I am  but they don't see the times you are a wreck in the middle of the night. I think close family must dread coming to visit as they don't know what to expect but my daughter is so understanding
Posts.Title: Not coping/coping with the wait for results.

Posts.Content: I fully understand how you feel. I am going for lymph node surgery this Thursday after mastectomy and reconstruction 2. Weeks ago and have struggled with sleep since diagnosed. I try to be positive but like you have moments where I break down for no reason and can't explain why my husband doesn't understand how I change for no reason.Rest when you need to and hope your results are good news. You will have the support from this group anytime you need to talk. X
Posts.Title: Not coping/coping with the wait for results.

Posts.Content: My daughter signed me up for Netflix ideal for 3am in the morning stints when I cant sleep
Posts.Title: Not coping/coping with the wait for results.

Posts.Content: I am an e cup on my good side and have had a small reconstruction on my right side but still need to weAr a full prosthesis in my swimsuit. I bought a swimsuit from Anoena and put my prosthesis in pocket it never moves and you can't tell the difference good  luck hope this helps x
Posts.Title: Swimming after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: I had my mastectomy for invasive ductal grade 2 cancer  in Oct and snb showed cancer in 1 lymph node so went back 1 week later and they took out 21 everyone was clear and margins were all good after mastectomy. No chemo or radiotherapy required as chemo only gave 2% improvement on 5 and 10 year prognosis so just taking Anastrozole. Still have moments where I feel tearful but it's getting less. Your consultant  is correct it is treatable but I can understand all your concerns it is perfectly normal keep in touch xx0
Posts.Title: reigning in the fear

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed in sep 2015 with grade 2 invasive ductal cancer and Dcis in another area of my breast following routine mammogram was also er positive.had mastectomy with implant reconstruction on 8th October 1 lymph node was positive so had lymph  nodes removed 3 weeks later. Results showed clear. Margins and no more lymph nodes affected so no chemo or radiotherapy required. Consultant started me on Anastrozole Immediaty f or next 5 years surgery healed quickly just my emotions go haywire now and again but getting there. You will get great support from your bcn and consultants don t be frightened to ask lots of question s.xx
Posts.Title: reigning in the fear

Posts.Content: I am having a latimmus dorsi reconstruction in May as my implant which was used last October following mastectomy left me unbalanced. Consultant said flap would be best option otherwise a larger implant is another option.  I'm concerned how long will recovery take before I get back to work and going normal activities? Thanks
Posts.Title: Latimmus flap reconstruction

Posts.Content: i am currently taking Anastrozole since last August and the skin on my face appears to have gone Very dry And looks like  I have aged over past 6 months. Any suggestions please I am62 years old and did not have wrinkly skin until recently
Posts.Title: Skin looks very dry on face

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed last August with micro papillary invasive breast cancer and had a mastectomy with implant reconstruction last October. First year mammogram was today and am now waiting for results in next 2 weeks. After the appointment j found myself very upset and husband doesn't understand why I feel like I do but can't help thinking what if it has returned, j didn't have chemo or radiotherapy and didn't expect to be so concerned.
Posts.Title: First year follow up mammogram

Posts.Content: Had my one year mammogram last Friday and received a call today from BCN saying don't worry nothing  wrong but we need to repeat your mammogram on Thursday as the images are not clear. How can you not worry after the last years events, hubby says they would have told you if they had concerns but I do not feel as confident as he does . Another horrible waiting game
Posts.Title: First year follow up mammogram
